business.headline: Raymond stock in spotlight as realty demerger takes effect. Check detailsAs per the approved scheme, Raymond shareholders will receive one equity share of Raymond Realty for every share held in Raymond. The standalone real estate company is expected to be listed during the September quarter of FY26.

Sensex surges over 400 points, Nifty nears 24,800 as inflation coolsAt 9:29 am, the BSE Sensex was up 462.27 points at 81,610.49, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 135.35 points to 24,713.70. Both indices extended gains shortly after the opening bell, signalling bullish momentum.

MSCI includes India's Coromandel, Nykaa to key index in May rejigThe inclusion could bring passive inflows worth $216 million-$227 million into Coromandel and $172 million - $181 million into Nykaa, according to IIFL Alternate Research and JM Financial estimates.

Stock market today: Sensex, Nifty likely to open positive as inflation coolsGift Nifty futures were quoting at 24,729.5 as of 8:15 am, suggesting the Nifty 50 could open comfortably above Tuesday's close of 24,578.35. This comes a day after the Sensex and Nifty logged their steepest single-day losses in a month.

Why Microsoft is firing about 6,000 employees while spending billions on AI?Microsoft is cutting around 6,000 jobs to save money, even while it spends big on artificial intelligence. The company says the move will help it focus on important areas as building AI tools is becoming more expensive and affecting profits.

Retail inflation declines to 6-year low of 3.16% in AprilRetail inflation dropped to a six-year low of 3.16% in April 2025 from 3.34% in March, thanks to cheaper vegetables, fruits, pulses, and protein-rich food.

Old vs new tax regime: Should your home loan decide for you?Home loan benefits are important, but they aren't the only ones to think about. Other deductions under the old regime, like Section 80D (health insurance), Section 80G (donations) and HRA (House Rent Allowance), also make a difference.

Sensex ends 1,282 points lower, Nifty below 24,600; Infosys down nearly 4%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 1,281.68 points to end at 81,148.22, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 346.35 points to close at 24,578.35.

Nissan reports loss of $4.5 billion amid financial woesNissan Q4: This is one of the biggest yearly losses in the company's history and a major drop compared to the previous year's net profit of 426.6 billion yen.

'Staying invested and staying patient': Radhika Gupta's advice after market surgeIndian stock markets surged over 3.7% on May 12, their strongest performance in nearly a year. The rally came after a ceasefire agreement between India and Pakistan over the weekend, along with positive signals from global markets and strong mutual fund inflows.

Crypto platforms asked to track J&K transactions for money laundering: ReportOver the last year, exchanges have made crypto withdrawals more restrictive, requiring users to provide more information about who is receiving the funds and why. These measures aim to curb misuse, given the anonymous and borderless nature of crypto.

Gold recovers as US-China tariff truce spurs bargain-buyingSpot gold was up 0.6% at $3,254.39 an ounce, as of 0639 GMT. Bullion recorded a 2.7% decline in the previous session. US gold futures GCcv1 were up 1% at $3,258.70.

entertainment.headline: Actor Nimrat says Sofiya Qureshi-Vyomika Singh's Op Sindoor briefing sends strong messageNimrat Kaur praised women officers Colonel Sofiya Qureshi and Wing Commander Vyomika Singh in Operation Sindoor, highlighting India's secularism and women empowerment.

Cannes 2025: Urvashi Rautela trolled over bold parrot clutch, colourful outfitAnother year, another bold look from Bollywood actor Urvashi Rautela. She walked the red carpet at the 78th Cannes Film Festival in a colourful ensemble, a tiara and a crystal parrot-shaped clutch, sparking buzz online.

Sonu Nigam moves Karnataka High Court to quash case over Bengaluru concert remarksSinger Sonu Nigam has approached the Karnataka High Court to quash an FIR filed against him for allegedly making objectionable remarks at a concert that reportedly hurt Kannadiga sentiments.

Robert Benton, Oscar-winning filmmaker behind Kramer vs. Kramer, dies at 92Robert Benton's son, John, said that he died Sunday at his home in Manhattan of 'natural causes.' During a 40-year screen career, the Texas native received six Oscar nominations and won three times.

Indian Idol 12 winner Pawandeep Rajan sings Mera Saaya from hospital room. WatchIndian Idol 12 winner Pawandeep Rajan was seen singing 'Mera Saaya' from the hospital room. He underwent multiple surgeries after being involved in a serious car accident.

Robert De Niro shreds 'Philistine President' Trump in fiery Cannes speechAcclaimed actor and filmmaker Robert De Niro was awarded the honorary Palme d'Or at Cannes Film Festival 2025 by Leonardo DiCaprio. In his acceptance speech, he slammed President Donald Trump and called for protests against him.

Stranger Things final season wraps filming, set for November 2025 releaseStranger Things has completed filming for its final season, marking the end of an iconic sci-fi saga. Cast and creators call the farewell emotional, with a potential late 2025 release on the horizon.

ESPN goes direct-to-consumer in Disney's bold streaming expansionDisney is launching a $29.99/month ESPN streaming service offering full sports coverage. It will also be bundled with Disney+ and Hulu, marking Disney's strongest push into direct-to-consumer sports streaming.

Disney's 2025 Snow White remake now streaming digitally in UK and USDisney's 2025 Snow White remake is now on digital platforms after mixed reviews and modest box office returns. It's expected to stream on Disney+ by late June or early July 2025.

Thought I was going to die: Kim Kardashian's tearful account of armed robberyKim Kardashian tearfully testified in Paris about her 2016-armed robbery, describing the traumatic ordeal that changed her life. The robbers tracked her online and made off with $6 million in jewelry.

Kali Uchis announces first arena tour: Dates, cities, and how to get ticketsKali Uchis launches her first headlining arena tour this summer, performing across 24 North American cities in support of her new album, Sincerely. Tickets are on sale now for all dates.

Anna Camp sparks romance rumors with stylist Jade Whipkey on InstagramAnna Camp appears to be dating stylist Jade Whipkey, as social media posts, TikToks, and public displays hint at a romantic connection. Neither party has officially confirmed the relationship.

Cassie testifies against Diddy in sex trafficking trial: Freak offs became a jobCassie delivered harrowing testimony in Diddy's sex trafficking trial, alleging years of abuse, coercion, and control. The court viewed damning video evidence as the trial against the music mogul intensifies.

Sitaare Zameen Par trailer: Aamir Khan returns with an uplifting new storyAamir Khan's new film 'Sitaare Zameen Par' trailer has been released, showcasing a heartwarming story. The film promotes inclusivity and introduces fresh talent, creating high expectations among audiences.

Hina Khan recreates iconic Goblin scene with Rocky Jaiswal during South Korea tripTelevision star Hina Khan is currently exploring South Korea, recreating iconic K-drama scenes with Rocky Jaiswal at the locations where they were filmed.

Tom Cruise jumps from 10,000 feet in Mission Impossible - Final Reckoning stuntTom Cruise shared BTS video from 'Mission: Impossible – The Final Reckoning', showcasing his stunt training for 10,000 feet jump from airplane. The film, releasing on May 23, 2025, marks the franchise's epic finale.

Amar Kaushik to direct Lust Stories 3 with Vikramaditya Motwane: ReportDirector Amar Kaushik will join Vikramaditya Motwane, Kiran Rao, and Shakun Batra to direct a short film in Netflix's upcoming 'Lust Stories 3'. This will mark Kaushik's first project outside his usual horror-comedy genre.

Alia Bhatt to postpone her Cannes debut amid India-Pak tensionActor Alia Bhatt is set to postpone her Cannes debut this year due to tensions between India and Pakistan. The actor was set to attend the festival on its opening day, May 13.

Kartik Aaryan shares pic with Sreeleela as they wrap schedule of Anurag Basu's filmKartik Aaryan shared a picture with Sreeleela from the sets of their upcoming film by Anurag Basu. The two shared their excitement as they wrapped a schedule of the film.

general news.headline: Trump advises India, Pak to 'have dinner together': Don't trade nuclear missilesAt a high-level gathering in Saudi Arabia, US President Donald Trump claimed of brokering a ceasefire between India and Pakistan, and suggested the nuclear-armed neighbours should "have dinner together" to ease tensions.

Not enough being said about Kashmiris killed in Pak shelling: Omar AbdullahSpeaking to India Today TV, Omar Abdullah expressed disappointment at what he termed a "lack of national attention" to the deaths of citizens of Jammu and Kashmir caused by Pakistan's cross-border shelling.

US official shuts down Pak reporter who accused PM Modi of blocking peace dealWhen the Pakistani reporter asked whether the US was disappointed that PM Modi did not welcome the 'peace deal,' US Department of State official Thomas Pigott said that the focus was on the ceasefire. 'Our focus is the ceasefire and encouraging direct communication,' said the US official.

Creative naming can't alter reality: India rejects China's Arunachal renamingIn a strongly worded statement, the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) firmly rejected China's latest attempt to rename several locations in Arunachal Pradesh.

Watch India Today special: Operation Sindoor reconstructed using AIIndia Today TV's special report on Operation Sindoor, using AI, reconstructs the daring, covert 100-hour Indian military mission that eliminated over 100 terrorists across nine cross-border camps with precision airstrikes, sending a powerful message of deterrence.

S Jaishankar's security enhanced with bulletproof car: Government sourcesAs per government sources, the security of External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has been increased with the addition of a bulletproof car and tighter measures around his residence in Delhi.

Justice BR Gavai to take oath as Chief Justice today, first Buddhist in the roleJustice Gavai will serve as the CJI until his retirement on November 23, 2025. As he dons the mantle of CJI, all eyes will be on him — not just for the judgments he delivers, but for the legacy he shapes.

Suspense over Hamas leader Muhammad Sinwar's fate after Israel airstrike: ReportHe is the younger brother of Yahya Sinwar, the former Hamas leader who was killed by Israeli forces in 2023. Yahya Sinwar was widely seen as the mastermind behind the October 7, 2023, attacks that triggered the ongoing war.

Sindoor tests India's ties with Trump's QuadWhile India waged a war on Pakistan-sponsored terror through Operation Sindoor, her so-called Quad allies ghosted her in real time. US President Donald Trump's diplomacy visibly turned the Quad from a strategic alliance into a WhatsApp group chat, leaving messages unread. The Quad's silence is bizarre as Pakistan is nothing more than a frontline Chinese province, and the grouping was formed with an eye on China.

Don't thrust Test captaincy on Shubman Gill, Bumrah best option: Kris SrikkanthIn an exclusive interaction, World Cup-winner, Kris Srikkanth, shared his thoughts on the race to succeed Rohit Sharma as India's next Test captain. While heaping praise on Virat Kohli's contributions to red-ball cricket, the former India opener also backed Sai Sudharsan for a long haul in Tests.

Robert De Niro shreds 'Philistine President' Trump in fiery Cannes speechAcclaimed actor and filmmaker Robert De Niro was awarded the honorary Palme d'Or at Cannes Film Festival 2025 by Leonardo DiCaprio. In his acceptance speech, he slammed President Donald Trump and called for protests against him.

Sensex surges over 400 points, Nifty nears 24,800 as inflation coolsAt 9:29 am, the BSE Sensex was up 462.27 points at 81,610.49, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 135.35 points to 24,713.70. Both indices extended gains shortly after the opening bell, signalling bullish momentum.

Cannes 2025: Urvashi Rautela trolled over bold parrot clutch, colourful outfitAnother year, another bold look from Bollywood actor Urvashi Rautela. She walked the red carpet at the 78th Cannes Film Festival in a colourful ensemble, a tiara and a crystal parrot-shaped clutch, sparking buzz online.

'Have Pahalgam terrorists been found?' CPM leader questions Operation SindoorCommunist Party Of India (Marxist) Rajya Sabha MP Bikash Ranjan Bhattacharya, during an interview, questioned if the goals of Operation Sindoor have been achieved. He asked if any terrorist involved in the Pahalgam terror attack had died.

BJP Minister's 'Pak' remark for Colonel Sofiya Qureshi backfires: What he saidThe MP tribal welfare minister's comments appeared to be an attempt to eulogise PM Modi over Operation Sindoor; the Congress has demanded his resignation

Cop says Padma Shri scientist couldn't swim: Suicide, accident or foul play?Police say Padma Shri scientist Dr Subbanna Ayyappan could not swim, yet his body was recovered from the Cauvery River. With no injuries or CCTV, the case raises troubling questions.

Thought I was going to die: Kim Kardashian's tearful account of armed robberyKim Kardashian tearfully testified in Paris about her 2016-armed robbery, describing the traumatic ordeal that changed her life. The robbers tracked her online and made off with $6 million in jewelry.

Virat Kohli retired due to excess cricket? Ex-World Cup winner weighs in1983 World Cup winner Syed Kirmani said that Virat Kohli should have continued playing Test cricket a little longer. On May 12, Kohli retired from Tests as India's fourth-highest run-scorer.

Live: US tight-lipped on Pak radiation leak reports after Op Sindoor strikesIndia-Pakistan Ceasefire Live: The Indian armed forces launched Operation Sindoor on May 7 to avenge the Pahalgam attack where 26 people - mostly tourists – were killed. Subsequently, the two countries were involved in military actions against each other. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh told an all-party meeting on May 8 that at least 100 hardcore terrorists and their associates were killed in Indian strikes on terror sites in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied-Kashmir (PoK) under the ongoing Operation Sindoor. The two neighbouring countries reached an understanding for ceasefire on May 10. Follow indiatoday.in for more updates.
Bengal BJP leader Dilip Ghosh's stepson found dead in Kolkata flatPritam Majumdar, the 26-year-old son of BJP leader Dilip Ghosh's wife from a previous marriage, was found dead in Kolkata on Tuesday.

Bengaluru man asks 'why no one's bombing PM Modi's house' in video, arrestedA Bengaluru-based man was arrested for posting a provocative video on social media calling for a bomb attack on Prime Minister Modi's residence. He was traced by police and sent to Parappana Agrahara jail.

Over 24k get over 95%, nearly 2 lakh over 90%: CBSE marks losing their meaning?Over 24,000 Class 12 students scored above 95% in the CBSE results 2025, while over 1.1 lakh students crossed the 90% mark. The numbers are even higher in CBSE Class 10 with nearly 2 lakh students scoring above 90%. But are these high marks truly meaningful, or are we just going through the motions?

Pak orders Indian diplomat to leave within 24 hours after espionage allegationsIndia and Pakistan expelled each other's diplomats amid rising tensions following Operation Sindoor. Both countries cited espionage and activities inconsistent with diplomatic roles.

Meet Kashish Chaudhary, Balochistan's first Hindu woman Assistant CommissionerKashish Chaudhary, accompanied by her father Girdhari Lal, met Balochistan Chief Minister Sarfaraz Bugti in Quetta and told him that she would work for the empowerment of women and minorities, and the overall development of the province.

Actor Nimrat says Sofiya Qureshi-Vyomika Singh's Op Sindoor briefing sends strong messageNimrat Kaur praised women officers Colonel Sofiya Qureshi and Wing Commander Vyomika Singh in Operation Sindoor, highlighting India's secularism and women empowerment.

Cannes 2025: Urvashi Rautela trolled over bold parrot clutch, colourful outfitAnother year, another bold look from Bollywood actor Urvashi Rautela. She walked the red carpet at the 78th Cannes Film Festival in a colourful ensemble, a tiara and a crystal parrot-shaped clutch, sparking buzz online.

Sonu Nigam moves Karnataka High Court to quash case over Bengaluru concert remarksSinger Sonu Nigam has approached the Karnataka High Court to quash an FIR filed against him for allegedly making objectionable remarks at a concert that reportedly hurt Kannadiga sentiments.

Robert Benton, Oscar-winning filmmaker behind Kramer vs. Kramer, dies at 92Robert Benton's son, John, said that he died Sunday at his home in Manhattan of 'natural causes.' During a 40-year screen career, the Texas native received six Oscar nominations and won three times.

sports.headline: Maradona's daughter testifies against football star's doctor for negligenceGianinna Maradona, Diego Maradona's daughter, told the court that her father's health had significantly deteriorated a month before his death, and that she had raised her concerns with Dr. Luque multiple times.

Don't thrust Test captaincy on Shubman Gill, Bumrah best option: Kris SrikkanthIn an exclusive interaction, World Cup-winner, Kris Srikkanth, shared his thoughts on the race to succeed Rohit Sharma as India's next Test captain. While heaping praise on Virat Kohli's contributions to red-ball cricket, the former India opener also backed Sai Sudharsan for a long haul in Tests.

Watch: Medvedev hits back at rowdy Rome crowd with aggressive responseItalian Open 2025: Daniil Medvedev faced a rowdy crowd in Rome that heckled him during his pre-quarterfinal match against Lorenzo Musetti on Tuesday, May 13.

Maharashtra CM meets Rohit Sharma, wishes him well after Test retirementMaharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis was delighted to meet Rohit Sharma at his residence, extending his best wishes after the Indian captain's retirement from Test cricket.

Virat Kohli retired due to excess cricket? Ex-World Cup winner weighs in1983 World Cup winner Syed Kirmani said that Virat Kohli should have continued playing Test cricket a little longer. On May 12, Kohli retired from Tests as India's fourth-highest run-scorer.

Why did you retire? Watch heartbroken fan confront Virat Kohli at airportVirat Kohli was confronted by a fan at Mumbai airport a day after announcing his retirement from Test cricket. Kohli announced his retirement from Test cricket, drawing the curtains on a stellar red-ball career.

Cristiano Ronaldo delighted as 14-year-old son debuts for Portugal U15 vs JapanCristiano Ronaldo was beaming with pride as his 14-year-old son, Cristiano Ronaldo Jr., made his debut for Portugal's U15 national team in a friendly match against Japan.

Sanjay Manjrekar shocked by Test captaincy rumours, strongly backs BumrahFormer India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has expressed disbelief at reports suggesting Jasprit Bumrah was not the frontrunner to replace Rohit Sharma as India's next Test captain.

Mohammed Shami quashes retirement rumour ahead of England Test squad selectionIndia tour of England: Fast bowler Mohammed Shami has been struggling for rhythm in IPL 2025, managing just 6 wickets in nine matches for SunRisers Hyderabad. India's Test squad for the tour of England is set to be picked in the third week of May.

Carlos Alcaraz joins Nadal in elite list, completes Masters 1000 quarter setCarlos Alcaraz joined his idol Rafael Nadal on the elite list after earning a hard-fought win over Karen Khachanov to storm to the quarter-finals at the 2025 Italian Open. Alcaraz has now reached the quarter-finals at all nine Masters 1000 tournaments.

Preity Zinta slams troll over Glenn Maxwell marriage joke: Stop the gender biasPreity Zinta confronted a sexist troll who questioned Glenn Maxwell's performance in IPL 2025. She called for greater respect towards women and highlighted the persistent gender bias in sports and on social media.

Cristiano Ronaldo delighted as 14-year-old son debuts for Portugal U15 vs JapanCristiano Ronaldo was beaming with pride as his 14-year-old son, Cristiano Ronaldo Jr., made his debut for Portugal's U15 national team in a friendly match against Japan.

Sanjay Manjrekar shocked by Test captaincy rumours, strongly backs BumrahFormer India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has expressed disbelief at reports suggesting Jasprit Bumrah was not the frontrunner to replace Rohit Sharma as India's next Test captain.

Mohammed Shami quashes retirement rumour ahead of England Test squad selectionIndia tour of England: Fast bowler Mohammed Shami has been struggling for rhythm in IPL 2025, managing just 6 wickets in nine matches for SunRisers Hyderabad. India's Test squad for the tour of England is set to be picked in the third week of May.

Carlos Alcaraz joins Nadal in elite list, completes Masters 1000 quarter setCarlos Alcaraz joined his idol Rafael Nadal on the elite list after earning a hard-fought win over Karen Khachanov to storm to the quarter-finals at the 2025 Italian Open. Alcaraz has now reached the quarter-finals at all nine Masters 1000 tournaments.

Preity Zinta slams troll over Glenn Maxwell marriage joke: Stop the gender biasPreity Zinta confronted a sexist troll who questioned Glenn Maxwell's performance in IPL 2025. She called for greater respect towards women and highlighted the persistent gender bias in sports and on social media.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
